cyclone.name: MINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles WSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the Florida Panhandle tonight, then tracking ENE across southern Georgia and South Carolina before emerging offshore into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Apalachicola–Mexico Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (watches limited to Florida Panhandle at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, southern Georgia, and coastal South Carolina (including the Charleston area)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph possible as the center passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected along the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain capable of 2–4 inches with localized higher totals leading to flash or urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado risk in outer rainbands on Thursday
